line: That boy you saw leaving with Mrs. Holvey - that wasn't Charlie.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're saying Mrs. Holvey left here with a ghost?

speaker: MULDER
line: A spirit, a ghost - I'm not sure but it's what we saw in the photograph. It's what the old woman was trying to protect the family from.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But, Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Whatever it is, it's killed three people, and you've got to get to Mrs. Holvey's before it happens again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you gonna do?

speaker: MULDER
line: Get help.

speaker: MAGGIE HOLVEY
line: There you go, Charlie.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Aren't you going to have some?

speaker: MAGGIE HOLVEY
line: No, dear. I'm not hungry.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Tomorrow we can go to the park.

speaker: MAGGIE HOLVEY
line: Yes. Sure.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Can I have a balloon?

speaker: MAGGIE HOLVEY
line: Uh-huh.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Can we ride the train, Mommy?

speaker: MAGGIE HOLVEY
line: Now you finish up and mommy will be right back, OK?

speaker: MAGGIE HOLVEY
line: nan

speaker: MAGGIE HOLVEY
line: Please, God. Don't let it be true.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: What are you doing, Mommy?

speaker: MAGGIE HOLVEY
line: nan

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Mommy?

speaker: MAGGIE HOLVEY
line: nan

speaker: HEAD CALUSARI
line: Guard the door.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs. Holvey?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: CHARLIE
line: Fie newt, avet a plaratariat. New potex... new potex... new potex. Suffragettes agitaball. Pulley tot allso puritay from freeditay. Suffragette a agitaball. Ohh saaa... pu chette... agitaball... boy gotz.

speaker: HEAD CALUSARI
line: Come. Hold him down.

speaker: HEAD CALUSARI
line: Don't look at him. Look away, or it will recognize you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Charlie?

speaker: CHARLIE'S VOICE COMING FROM MAGGIE
line: Mommy?

speaker: CHARLIE
line: It hurts!

speaker: HEAD CALUSARI
line: Do not let go. He tricks you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you all right?

speaker: MAGGIE HOLVEY
line: Charlie?

speaker: HEAD CALUSARI
line: Let the boy rest. We must find the mother. The boy needs her.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, you all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're OK. How's Charlie?

speaker: MAGGIE HOLVEY
line: Charlie! It's OK! Charlie!

speaker: HEAD CALUSARI
line: It is over, for now. But you must be careful. It knows you.

speaker: MULDER
line: The strange case of Charlie Holvey and the deaths that occurred during his possession by a dark and malevolent force are unsolved...

speaker: MULDER
line: ... The boy, who will celebrate his tenth birthday next month, remains under the watchful care of his mother. And though I believe him innocent of the crimes, I am disturbed by the warnings of the Calusari that neither innocence nor vigilance may be protection against the howling heart of evil.
